intro: Tricalysia whitfordii, commonly known as the whiteflowered tamarind, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Tricalysia whitfordii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local communities.
